p: However, there is a large body of evidence that DAA therapy in PWID offers sustained virological response rates 12 weeks after treatment completion (SVR12) similar to those in non-PWID populations [ 11- 16]. A reasonable concern in a marginalized population is compliance with treatment; indeed, although the proportion of patients lost to follow up (LTFU) is small in randomized clinical trials [ 13, 17], data from real-world settings are scanty and conflicting [ 12, 18- 21]. The rate of LTFU and the factors that may affect engagement with treatment and follow up will add crucial information to improve HCV service delivery and treatment.
